title: András Sebő
summary: András Sebő (born 24 April 1954) is a Hungarian-French mathematician working in the areas of combinatorial optimization and discrete mathematics. Sebő is a French National Centre for Scientific Research (CNRS) Director of Research and the head of the Combinatorial Optimization.[1] group in Laboratory G-SCOP,[2] affiliated with the University of Grenoble and the CNRS.
